column4: Hello. Is the auto-hide lancher option supposed to make the left column-like launcher disappear until you mouse-over it?
Because it doesn't.
It just makes its background somewhat transparent
It still gets in the way (it is over) of my maximized windows
How can I make it disappear?
I mean, when I maximize a window I don't want the launcher to e over it
Or at least the window should maximize until the laucher and not under it
If not over it
http://askubuntu.com/questions/9865/how-can-i-configure-unitys-launcher-auto-hide-behavior/106673#106673
Did you try the slider?
I turned auto-hide on, but all it did was make the launcher's background transparent. It never makes it hide and it gets in the way of my maximized windows :S
Do you have the sensitivity on high?
no it's on default
Try putting it the highest
nothing, it never disappears
You could try this: http://askubuntu.com/a/43708
gconf-editor does not run. I just click on it and nothing happens
In the terminal
the laucher did not hide (and never does) but at least that started causing the auto-hide option when I get it to Off, to make maximized windows until the launcher, and not under it
so it didn't really fix the never hiding launcher problem, but at least I can see the whole of my maximized windows
should I file a bug then?
You could, but you should reproduce it on a clean install first really
I am on a clean install
I cannot file a bug, ubuntu-bug says development for Precise is over so I should work this through with technical support. What should I do?
